CustomEvent.name: CustomEvent
CustomEvent.description:
The CustomEvent class lets you define events for your application
that can be subscribed to by one or more independent component.

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of event, which is passed to the callback
when the event fires

params.name: o
params.description: configuration object

constructors.description:
The CustomEvent class lets you define events for your application
that can be subscribed to by one or more independent component.

queuable.description:
Specifies whether this event should be queued when the host is actively
processing an event.  This will effect exectution order of the callbacks
for the various events.

monitor.description: Monitor when an event is attached or detached.

defaultFn.description:
The default function to execute after event listeners
have fire, but only if the default action was not
prevented.

fireOnce.description:
This event should only fire one time if true, and if
it has fired, any new subscribers should be notified
immediately.

prevented.description:
Flag for preventDefault that is modified during fire().
if it is not 0, the default behavior for this event

preventedFn.description:
The function to execute if a subscriber calls
preventDefault

emitFacade.description:
If set to true, the custom event will deliver an EventFacade object
that is similar to a DOM event object.

broadcast.description:
If 0, this event does not broadcast.  If 1, the YUI instance is notified
every time this event fires.  If 2, the YUI instance and the YUI global
(if event is enabled on the global) are notified every time this event
fires.

firedWith.description:
An array containing the arguments the custom event
was last fired with.

host.description:
Specifies the host for this custom event.  This is used
to enable event bubbling

stopped.description:
Flag for stopPropagation that is modified during fire()
1 means to stop propagation to bubble targets.  2 means
to also stop additional subscribers on this target.

fired.description: This event has fired if true

context.description:
The context the the event will fire from by default.  Defaults to the YUI
instance.

signature.description:
Supports multiple options for listener signatures in order to
port YUI 2 apps.

preventable.description:
Specifies whether or not this event's default function
can be cancelled by a subscriber by executing preventDefault() 
on the event facade

stoppedFn.description:
The function to execute if a subscriber calls
stopPropagation or stopImmediatePropagation

type.description: The type of event, returned to subscribers when the event fires

bubbles.description:
Specifies whether or not a subscriber can stop the event propagation
via stopPropagation(), stopImmediatePropagation(), or halt()

silent.description:
By default all custom events are logged in the debug build, set silent
to true to disable debug outpu for this event.

return.description:
unsubscribe handle or a
chainable event target depending on the 'chain' config.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

preventDefault.description: Prevents the execution of this event's defaultFn

params.name: immediate
params.description:
if true additional listeners
on the current target will not be executed

halt.description:
Stops the event propagation and prevents the default
event behavior.

params.name: subscriber
params.description: object

return.description:
false if one of the subscribers returned false, 
true otherwise

params.name: arguments
params.description:
an arbitrary set of parameters to pass to 
the handler.

fire.description:
Notifies the subscribers. The callback functions will be executed from the context specified when the event was created, and with the following parameters:
  • The type of event
  • All of the arguments fire() was executed with as an array
  • The custom object (if any) that was passed into the subscribe() method

return.description: The number of listeners unsubscribed

stopImmediatePropagation.description:
Stops propagation to bubble targets, and prevents any remaining
subscribers on the current target from executing.

params.name: o
params.description: hash of properties to apply

params.name: force
params.description:
if true, properties that exist on the event 
will be overwritten.

applyConfig.description: Apply configuration properties.  Only applies the CONFIG whitelist

return.description: The number of listeners unsubscribed

params.name: s
params.description: the subscriber

params.name: args
params.description: the arguments array to apply to the listener

return.description:
unsubscribe handle or a
chainable event target depending on the 'chain' config.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

return.description:
returns a chainable event target
or a boolean for legacy detach support.

params.name: fn
params.description:
The subscribed function to remove, if not supplied
all will be removed

params.name: context
params.description: The context object passed to subscribe.

return.description:
returns a chainable event target
or the number of subscribers unsubscribed.

params.name: fn
params.description:
The subscribed function to remove, if not supplied
all will be removed

params.name: context
params.description: The context object passed to subscribe.

return.description:
unsubscribe handle or a
chainable event target depending on the 'chain' config.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

after.description:
Listen for this event after the normal subscribers have been notified and
the default behavior has been applied.  If a normal subscriber prevents the 
default behavior, it also prevents after listeners from firing.

params.name: msg
params.description: message to log

params.name: cat
params.description: log category

log.description: Logger abstraction to centralize the application of the silent flag

DataSource.Get.name: DataSource.Get

scriptCallbackParam.description:
Callback string parameter name sent to the remote script. By default,
requests are sent to
<URI>?<scriptCallbackParam>=callbackFunction

asyncMode.description:
Defines request/response management in the following manner:
<dl>
<!--<dt>queueRequests</dt>
<dd>If a request is already in progress, wait until response is returned before sending the next request.</dd>
<dt>cancelStaleRequests</dt>
<dd>If a request is already in progress, cancel it before sending the next request.</dd>-->
<dt>ignoreStaleResponses</dt>
<dd>Send all requests, but handle only the response for the most recently sent request.</dd>
<dt>allowAll</dt>
<dd>Send all requests and handle all responses.</dd>
</dl>

generateRequestCallback.description:
Accepts the DataSource instance and a callback ID, and returns a callback
param/value string that gets appended to the script URI. Implementers
can customize this string to match their server's query syntax.

Plugin.Align.description:
Node plugin which can be used to align a node with another node,
region, or the viewport.

params.description: The plugin class, or an array of plugin classes

to.parm:
region {Node || HTMLElement || Object} optional The node or
region to align with. Defaults to the viewport region.
to.description:
Aligns node with a point on another node or region.
Possible alignment points are:
<dl>
<dt>tl</dt>
<dd>top left</dd>
<dt>tr</dt>
<dd>top right</dd>
<dt>bl</dt>
<dd>bottom left</dd>
<dt>br</dt>
<dd>bottom right</dd>
<dt>tc</dt>
<dd>top center</dd>
<dt>bc</dt>
<dd>bottom center</dd>
<dt>rc</dt>
<dd>right center</dd>
<dt>lc</dt>
<dd>left center</dd>
</dl>

params.description: Either the plugin class, an array of plugin classes or an array of objects (with fn and cfg properties defined)

region to align with. Defaults to the viewport region.

Removes the resize handler, if any. This is called automatically
when unplugged from the host node.

getFunctionReport.description:
Returns an object containing profiling data for a single function.
The object has an entry for min, max, avg, calls, and points).

pause.description: Pauses profiling information for a given name.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the data point.

return.description: An object containing profile data for a given function.

getReport.description:
Returns an object containing profiling data for a single function.
The object has an entry for min, max, avg, calls, and points).

start.description:
Start profiling information for a given name. The name cannot be the name
of a registered function or object. This is used to start timing for a
particular block of code rather than instrumenting the entire function.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the data point.

return.description: An object containing all profile data.

getFullReport.description:
Returns an object containing profiling data for all of the functions 
that were profiled. The object has an entry for each function and 
returns all information (min, max, average, calls, etc.) for each
function.

unregisterFunction.description: Removes a constructor function from profiling. Reverses the registerConstructor() method.
unregisterFunction.param:
{String} name The full name of the function including namespacing. This
is the name of the function that is stored in the report.

params.name: name
params.description:
The full name of the function including namespacing. This
is the name of the function that is stored in the report.

clear.description: Removes all report data from the profiler.

params.name: name
params.description:
(Optional) The name of the report to clear. If
omitted, then all report data is cleared.

stop.description: Stops profiling information for a given name.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the data point.

return.description: The number of times the function was called.

getCallCount.description: Returns the number of times that the given function has been called.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the function whose data should be returned.

registerFunction.description:
Sets up a function for profiling. It essentially overwrites the function with one
that has instrumentation data. This method also creates an entry for the function
in the profile report. The original function is stored on the container object.

params.name: name
params.description:
The full name of the function including namespacing. This
is the name of the function that is stored in the report.

params.name: owner
params.description:
(Optional) The object that owns the function. If the function
isn't global then this argument is required. This could be the namespace that
the function belongs to or the object on which it's
a method.

params.name: registerPrototype
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates that the prototype should
also be instrumented. Setting to true has the same effect as calling
registerConstructor().

return.description: An instrumented version of the function.

instrument.description: Instruments a method to have profiling calls.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the report for the function.

params.name: method
params.description: The function to instrument.

return.description: The uninstrumented version of a function/object.

getOriginal.description: Returns the uninstrumented version of a function/object.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the function/object to retrieve.

return.description: The average time it takes the function to execute.

getAverage.description:
Returns the average amount of time (in milliseconds) that the function
with the given name takes to execute.

params.name: name

return.description: The minimum time it takes the function to execute.

getMin.description:
Returns the minimum amount of time (in milliseconds) that the function
with the given name takes to execute.

params.name: name

unregisterObject.description:
Unregisters an object for profiling. It takes the object and looks for functions.
When a function is found, unregisterMethod() is called on it. If set to recrusive
mode, it will also unregister objects found inside of this object, 
using the same methodology.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the object to unregister.

params.name: recurse
params.description:
(Optional) Determines if subobject methods should also be
unregistered.

return.description: The maximum time it takes the function to execute.

getMax.description:
Returns the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) that the function
with the given name takes to execute.

params.name: name

registerConstructor.description: Sets up a constructor for profiling, including all properties and methods on the prototype.

params.name: name
params.description: The fully-qualified name of the function including namespace information.

params.name: owner
params.description: (Optional) The object that owns the function (namespace or containing object).

registerObject.description:
Sets up an object for profiling. It takes the object and looks for functions.
When a function is found, registerMethod() is called on it. If set to recrusive
mode, it will also setup objects found inside of this object for profiling, 
using the same methodology.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the object to profile (shows up in report).

params.name: owner
params.description: (Optional) The object represented by the name.

params.name: recurse
params.description: (Optional) Determines if subobject methods are also profiled.

Queue.name: Queue

indexOf.description: Returns the current index in the queue of the specified item

params.name: item

remove.description: Removes the referenced item from the queue

return.description: the next item in the queue

next.description: Get the next item in the queue.

params.name: item*
params.description: 0..n items

add.description: Add 0..n items to the end of the queue

params.name: item
params.description: an item in the queue

promote.description: Moves the referenced item to the head of the queue

size.description: Returns the current number of queued items

Queue.param: item* {MIXED} 0..n items to seed the queue
Queue.description:
A simple FIFO queue.  Items are added to the Queue with add(1..n items) and
removed using next().

_maxKnownHLimit.description:
The maximum pixel height of the document that has been made visible.
During fold checks, if the user scrolls up then there's no need to check for newly exposed images.

_imgObjs.description: Collection of images (Y.ImgLoadImgObj objects) registered with this group, keyed by DOM id.

_classImageEls.description: DOM elements having the class name that is associated with this group. Elements are stored during the _foldCheck function and reused later during any subsequent _foldCheck calls - gives a slight performance improvement when the page fold is repeatedly checked.

_triggers.description: Collection of triggers for this group. Keeps track of each trigger's event handle, as returned from Y.on.

_className.description: Keep the CSS class name in a member variable for ease and speed.

_timeout.description: Timeout object to keep a handle on the time limit.

params.description: The object on which to attach the event. obj is optional - by default the event is attached to the Y instance

addCustomTrigger.description: Adds a custom event trigger to the group.

params.name: obj
params.description: The DOM object to attach the trigger event to

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

addTrigger.description: Adds a trigger to the group. Arguments are passed to Y.on.

_setFoldTriggers.description: Sets the window scroll and window resize triggers for any group that is fold-conditional (i.e., has a fold distance set).

_init.description: Initialize all private members needed for the group.

_clearTriggers.description: Clears the timeout and all triggers associated with the group.

return.description: group's fetch method

_getFetchTimeout.description: Returns the group's fetch method, with the proper closure, for use with setTimeout.

_onloadTasks.description:
Performs necessary setup at domready time.
Initiates time limit for group; executes the fold check for the images.

return.description: Y.ImgLoadImgObj that was registered

params.description: A configuration object literal with attribute name/value pairs (passed through to a Y.ImgLoadImgObj constructor)

registerImage.description: Registers an image with the group. Arguments are passed through to a Y.ImgLoadImgObj constructor; see that class' attribute documentation for detailed information. "domId" is a required attribute.

_foldCheck.description: Checks the position of each image in the group. If any part of the image is within the specified distance (foldDistance) of the client viewport, the image is fetched immediately.

fetch.description:
Displays the images in the group.
This method is called when a trigger fires or the time limit expires; it shouldn't be called externally, but is not private in the rare event that it needs to be called immediately.

_fetchByClass.description: Finds all elements in the DOM with the class name specified in the group. Removes the class from the element in order to let the style definitions trigger the image fetching.

className.description: Class name that will identify images belonging to the group. This class name will be removed from each element in order to fetch images. This class should have, in its CSS style definition, "background:none !important;".

timeLimit.description: Time limit, in seconds, after which images are fetched regardless of trigger events.

foldDistance.description:
Distance below the fold for which images are loaded. Images are not loaded until they are at most this distance away from (or above) the fold.
This check is performed at page load (domready) and after any window scroll or window resize event (until all images are loaded).

name.description: Name for the group. Only used to identify the group in logging statements.

ImgLoadGroup.description: A group for images. A group can have one time limit and a series of triggers. Thus the images belonging to this group must share these constraints.

_isValidCollection.description:
We want to be able to use getElementsByTagName as a collection
to attach a group of events to.  Unfortunately, different 
browsers return different types of collections.  This function
tests to determine if the object is array-like.  It will also 
fail if the object is an array, but is empty.

Works the same way as onAvailable, but additionally checks the state of sibling elements to determine if the content of the available element is safe to modify.

The callback is executed with a single parameter: the custom object parameter, if provided.

onAvailable.description:
Executes the supplied callback when the item with the supplied id is found. This is meant to be used to execute behavior as soon as possible as the page loads. If you use this after the initial page load it will poll for a fixed time for the element. The number of times it will poll and the frequency are configurable. By default it will poll for 10 seconds.

The callback is executed with a single parameter: the custom object parameter, if provided.

return.description: true if the unbind was successful, false otherwise.

detach.description:
Removes an event listener.  Supports the signature the event was bound
with, but the preferred way to remove listeners is using the handle
that is returned when using Y.on

params.name: type
params.description: the type of event to remove.

params.name: fn
params.description:
the method the event invokes.  If fn is
undefined, then all event handlers for the type of event are 
removed.

params.name: el
params.description:
An 
event handle, an id, an element reference, or a collection 
of ids and/or elements to remove the listener from.

DOMReady.description: True when the document is initially usable

_retryCount.description:
The number of times to poll after window.onload.  This number is
increased if additional late-bound handlers are requested after
the page load.

POLL_RETRYS.description:
The number of times we should look for elements that are not
in the DOM at the time the event is requested after the document
has been loaded.  The default is 1000@amp;40 ms, so it will poll
for 40 seconds or until all outstanding handlers are bound
(whichever comes first).

_wrappers.description:
Custom event wrappers for DOM events.  Key is 
'event:' + Element uid stamp + event type

_loadComplete.description: True after the onload event has fired

_el_events.description:
Custom event wrapper map DOM events.  Key is 
Element uid stamp.  Each item is a hash of custom event
wrappers as provided in the _wrappers collection.  This
provides the infrastructure for getListeners.

lastError.description:
addListener/removeListener can throw errors in unexpected scenarios.
These errors are suppressed, the method returns false, and this property
is set

Event.description:
The event utility provides functions to add and remove event listeners,
event cleansing.  It also tries to automatically remove listeners it
registers during the unload event.

UA.name: UA

secure.description: Set to true if the page appears to be in SSL

ie.description: Internet Explorer version number or 0.  Example: 6

air.description:
Adobe AIR version number or 0.  Only populated if webkit is detected.
Example: 1.0

mobile.description:
The mobile property will be set to a string containing any relevant
user agent information when a modern mobile browser is detected.
Currently limited to Safari on the iPhone/iPod Touch, Nokia N-series
devices with the WebKit-based browser, and Opera Mini.

os.description: The operating system.  Currently only detecting windows or macintosh

webkit.description:
AppleWebKit version. KHTML browsers that are not WebKit browsers will evaluate to 1, other browsers 0. Example: 418.9 
Safari 1.3.2 (312.6): 312.8.1 <-- Reports 312.8 -- currently the 
latest available for Mac OSX 10.3.
Safari 2.0.2:         416     <-- hasOwnProperty introduced
Safari 2.0.4:         418     <-- preventDefault fixed
Safari 2.0.4 (419.3): 418.9.1 <-- One version of Safari may run
different versions of webkit
Safari 2.0.4 (419.3): 419     <-- Tiger installations that have been
updated, but not updated
to the latest patch.
Webkit 212 nightly:   522+    <-- Safari 3.0 precursor (with native SVG
and many major issues fixed).
Safari 3.0.4 (523.12) 523.12  <-- First Tiger release - automatic update
from 2.x via the 10.4.11 OS patch
Webkit nightly 1/2008:525+    <-- Supports DOMContentLoaded event.
yahoo.com user agent hack removed.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Safari_(web_browser)#Version_history

gecko.description:
Gecko engine revision number. Will evaluate to 1 if Gecko is detected but the revision could not be found. Other browsers will be 0. Example: 1.8 
Firefox 1.0.0.4: 1.7.8   <-- Reports 1.7
Firefox 1.5.0.9: 1.8.0.9 <-- Reports 1.8
Firefox 2.0.0.3: 1.8.1.3 <-- Reports 1.8
Firefox 3 alpha: 1.9a4   <-- Reports 1.9

UA.description:
YUI user agent detection.
Do not fork for a browser if it can be avoided.  Use feature detection when
you can.  Use the user agent as a last resort.  UA stores a version
number for the browser engine, 0 otherwise.  This value may or may not map
to the version number of the browser using the engine.  The value is 
presented as a float so that it can easily be used for boolean evaluation 
as well as for looking for a particular range of versions.  Because of this, 
some of the granularity of the version info may be lost (e.g., Gecko 1.8.0.9 
reports 1.8).

entry in the cache. Returns null if there is no cache match.

Adds a new entry to the cache of the format
{request:request, response:response, payload:payload}.
If cache is full, evicts the stalest entry before adding the new one.

params.description: Event Facade object.

_isMatch.description:
Default overridable method compares current request with given cache entry.
Returns true if current request matches the cached request, otherwise
false. Implementers should override this method to customize the
cache-matching algorithm.

_fetched.description:
Whether this image has already been fetched.
In the case of fold-conditional groups, images won't be fetched twice.

_yPos.description: The vertical position returned from getY, to avoid repeat calls to access the DOM. The Y position is checked only for images registered with fold-conditional groups. The position is checked first at page load (domready) and this caching enhancement assumes that the image's vertical position won't change after that first check.

_getYPos.returns: {Object} The Y position of the image
_getYPos.description:
Gets the Y position of the node in page coordinates.
Expects that the page-coordinate position of the image won't change.

_getImgEl.returns: {Object} DOM element of the image as a Y.Node object
_getImgEl.description: Gets the object (as a Y.Node) of the DOM element indicated by "domId".

_init.description: Initialize all private members needed for the group.

return.description: Whether the image has been fetched (either during this execution or previously)

params.name: withinY
params.description: The pixel distance from the top of the page, for which if the image lies within, it will be fetched. Undefined indicates that no check should be made, and the image should always be fetched

fetch.description:
Displays the image; puts the URL into the DOM.
This method shouldn't be called externally, but is not private in the rare event that it needs to be called immediately.

isPng.description:
Whether the image is a PNG.
PNG images get special treatment in that the URL is specified through AlphaImageLoader for IE, versions 6 and earlier.
Only used with background images.

srcUrl.description: Source URL for the image. For an image whose URL is specified by a "src" attribute in the DOM element.

enabled.description: AlphaImageLoader enabled property to be set for the image. Only set if isPng value for this image is set to true. Defaults to true.

domId.description: HTML DOM id of the image element.

height.description: Pixel height of the image. Will be set as a height attribute on the DOM element after the image is fetched. Defaults to the natural height of the image (no height attribute will be set). Usually only used with src images.

width.description: Pixel width of the image. Will be set as a width attribute on the DOM element after the image is fetched. Defaults to the natural width of the image (no width attribute will be set). Usually only used with src images.

sizingMethod.description: AlphaImageLoader sizingMethod property to be set for the image. Only set if isPng value for this image is set to true. Defaults to scale.

bgUrl.description: Background URL for the image. For an image whose URL is specified by "background-image" in the element's style.

setVisible.description: Whether the image's style.visibility should be set to visible after the image is fetched. Used when setting images as visibility:hidden prior to image fetching.

ImgLoadImgObj.description: Image objects to be registered with the groups

plugin.NodeMenuNav.name: plugin.NodeMenuNav

submenuHideDelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should expire before a 
submenu is hidden when the user mouses out of a menu label heading in the 
direction of a submenu.

useARIA.description:
Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be 
enabled for the menu.

autoSubmenuDisplay.description:
Boolean indicating if submenus are automatically made visible when the 
user mouses over the menu's items.

mouseOutHideDelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should expire before a 
submenu is hidden when the user mouses out of it.

submenuShowDelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should expire before a 
submenu is made visible when the user mouses over the menu's label.

You can listen for the event using the on method if you wish to be notified before the attribute's value has changed, or using the after method if you wish to be notified after the attribute's value has changed.

Test.Runner.name: Test.Runner

testcasebegin.description:
Fires when a test case is opened but before the first 
test is executed.

testcasecomplete.description: Fires when all tests in a test case have been executed.

begin.description: Fires when the run() method is called.

ignore.description: Fires when a test has been ignored.

testsuitebegin.description:
Fires when a test suite is opened but before the first 
test is executed.

testsuitecomplete.description:
Fires when all test cases in a test suite have been
completed.

pass.description: Fires when a test has passed.

fail.description: Fires when a test has failed.

complete.description: Fires when all test suites and test cases have been completed.

disableLogging.description:
Disable logging via Y.log(). Test output will not be visible unless
TestRunner events are subscribed to.

return.description: Results of the execution with properties passed, failed, and total.

_run.description: Runs a test case or test suite, returning the results.

params.name: testObject
params.description: The test case or test suite to run.

return.description: True if the TestRunner is running, false if not.

isRunning.description:
Indicates that the TestRunner is busy running tests and therefore can't
be stopped and results cannot be gathered.

resume.description: Resumes the TestRunner after wait() was called.

params.name: segment
params.description:
The function to run as the rest
of the haulted test.

params.name: event
params.description: The event object for the event.

_addTestCaseToTestTree.description: Adds a test case to the test tree as a child of the specified node.

params.name: parentNode
params.description: The node to add the test case to as a child.

params.name: testCase
params.description: The test case to add.

clear.description: Removes all test objects from the runner.

return.description:
Either the results object or, if a test format is 
passed as the argument, a string representing the results in a specific
format.

params.name: format
params.description: (Optional) A test format to return the results in.

getResults.description:
Returns the last complete results set from the TestRunner. Null is returned
if the TestRunner is running or no tests have been run.

enableLogging.description:
Enable logging via Y.log(). Test output is published and can be read via
logreader.

_buildTestTree.description:
Builds the test tree based on items in the master suite. The tree is a hierarchical
representation of the test suites, test cases, and test functions. The resulting tree
is stored in _root and the pointer _cur is set to the root initially.

_addTestSuiteToTestTree.description: Adds a test suite to the test tree as a child of the specified node.

params.name: parentNode
params.description: The node to add the test suite to as a child.

params.name: testSuite
params.description: The test suite to add.

_handleTestObjectComplete.description:
Handles the completion of a test object's tests. Tallies test results 
from one level up to the next.

params.name: node
params.description: The TestNode representing the test object.

add.description: Adds a test suite or test case to the list of test objects to run.

params.name: testObject
params.description: Either a TestCase or a TestSuite that should be run.

return.description: True if the TestRunner is waiting, false if not.

isWaiting.description: Indicates if the TestRunner is waiting for a test to resume

return.description: The next node in the test tree or null if the end is reached.

_next.description: Retrieves the next node in the test tree.

_handleError.description:
Handles an error as if it occurred within the currently executing
test. This is for mock methods that may be called asynchronously
and therefore out of the scope of the TestRunner. Previously, this
error would bubble up to the browser. Now, this method is used
to tell TestRunner about the error. This should never be called
by anyplace other than the Mock object.

params.name: error
params.description: The error object.

_runTest.description: Runs a single test based on the data provided in the node.

params.name: node
params.description: The TestNode representing the test to run.

_runTest.name: _runTest

_running.description: Indicates if the TestRunner is currently running tests.

_root.description: Pointer to the root node in the test tree.

masterSuite.description: Suite on which to attach all TestSuites and TestCases to be run.

_log.description: Indicates if the TestRunner will log events or not.

_waiting.description:
Indicates if the TestRunner is waiting as a result of
wait() being called.

_cur.description: Pointer to the current node in the test tree.

_lastResults.description:
Holds copy of the results object generated when all tests are
complete.

Test.Runner.description:
Runs test suites and test cases, providing events to allowing for the
interpretation of test results.

script.description:
Fetches and inserts one or more script nodes into the head
of the current document or the document in a specified window.

params.name: url
params.description: the url or urls to the script(s)

params.name: opts
params.description:
Options:
onSuccess
callback to execute when the script(s) are finished loading The callback receives an object back with the following data:
win
the window the script(s) were inserted into
data
the data object passed in when the request was made
nodes
An array containing references to the nodes that were inserted
purge
A function that, when executed, will remove the nodes that were inserted
onTimeout
callback to execute when a timeout occurs. The callback receives an object back with the following data:
win
the window the script(s) were inserted into
data
the data object passed in when the request was made
nodes
An array containing references to the nodes that were inserted
purge
A function that, when executed, will remove the nodes that were inserted
onEnd
a function that executes when the transaction finishes, regardless of the exit path
onFailure
callback to execute when the script load operation fails The callback receives an object back with the following data:
win
the window the script(s) were inserted into
data
the data object passed in when the request was made
nodes
An array containing references to the nodes that were inserted successfully
purge
A function that, when executed, will remove any nodes that were inserted
context
the execution context for the callbacks
win
a window other than the one the utility occupies
autopurge
setting to true will let the utilities cleanup routine purge the script once loaded
purgethreshold
The number of transaction before autopurge should be initiated
data
data that is supplied to the callback when the script(s) are loaded.
insertBefore
node or node id that will become the new node's nextSibling
charset
Node charset, default utf-8 (deprecated, use the attributes config)
attributes
An object literal containing additional attributes to add to the link tags
timeout
Number of milliseconds to wait before aborting and firing the timeout event
  Y.Get.script(
  ["http://yui.yahooapis.com/2.5.2/build/yahoo/yahoo-min.js",
   "http://yui.yahooapis.com/2.5.2/build/event/event-min.js"], {
    onSuccess: function(o) {
      this.log("won't cause error because Y is the context");
      Y.log(o.data); // foo
      Y.log(o.nodes.length === 2) // true
      // o.purge(); // optionally remove the script nodes immediately
    },
    onFailure: function(o) {
      Y.log("transaction failed");
    },
    onTimeout: function(o) {
      Y.log("transaction timed out");
    },
    data: "foo",
    timeout: 10000, // 10 second timeout
    context: Y, // make the YUI instance
    // win: otherframe // target another window/frame
    autopurge: true // allow the utility to choose when to remove the nodes
    purgetheshold: 1 // purge previous transaction before next transaction
  });

params.description:
Options:
onSuccess
callback to execute when the css file(s) are finished loading The callback receives an object back with the following data:
win
the window the link nodes(s) were inserted into
data
the data object passed in when the request was made
nodes
An array containing references to the nodes that were inserted
purge
A function that, when executed, will remove the nodes that were inserted
context
the execution context for the callbacks
win
a window other than the one the utility occupies
data
data that is supplied to the callbacks when the nodes(s) are loaded.
insertBefore
node or node id that will become the new node's nextSibling
charset
Node charset, default utf-8 (deprecated, use the attributes config)
attributes
An object literal containing additional attributes to add to the link tags

centered.description:
A convenience attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the align attribute.
If set to true, the Widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a node reference or valid selector string,
the Widget will be centered within the node. If set the false, no center positioning is applied.

align.desciption:
The align attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the refernce point on another node, or the viewport. The object which align expects has the following properties:
node
The node to which the Widget is to be aligned. If set to null, or not provided, the Widget is aligned to the viewport
points

A two element array, defining the two points on the Widget and node/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the Widget, and the second element is the point on the node/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on WidgetPositionExt.

e.g. [WidgetPositionExt.TR, WidgetPositionExt.TL] aligns the Top-Right corner of the Widget with the Top-Left corner of the node/viewport, and [WidgetPositionExt.CC, WidgetPositionExt.TC] aligns the Center of the Widget with the Top-Center edge of the node/viewport.

params.name: widgetPoint
params.description: Supported point constant (e.g. WidgetPositionExt.TL)

params.name: x
params.description: X page co-ordinate to align to

params.name: y
params.description: Y page co-ordinate to align to

_doAlign.description: Helper method, used to align the given point on the widget, with the XY page co-ordinates provided.

_syncUIPosExtras.description:
Synchronizes the UI to match the Widgets extended positioning state.
This method in invoked after syncUI is invoked for the Widget class
using YUI's aop infrastructure.

params.name: node
params.description:
Optional. A node reference or selector string defining the node 
inside which the Widget is to be centered. If not passed in, the Widget will be centered in the 
viewport.

centered.description:
Centers the container in the viewport, or if a node is passed in,
the node.

params.name: node
params.description:
A reference (or selector string) for the Node which with the Widget is to be aligned.
If null is passed in, the Widget will be aligned with the viewport.

params.name: points
params.description:
A two element array, specifying the points on the Widget and node/viewport which need to be aligned. 
The first entry is the point on the Widget, and the second entry is the point on the node/viewport which need to align.
Valid point references are defined as static constants on the WidgetPositionExt class. 
e.g. [WidgetPositionExt.TL, WidgetPositionExt.TR] will align the top-left corner of the Widget with the top-right corner of the node/viewport.

align.description:
Aligns the Widget to the provided node (or viewport) using the provided
points. The method can be invoked directly, however it will result in 
the align attribute being out of sync with current position of the of Widget.

parse.description: Parse a JSON string, returning the native JavaScript representation.

return.description: JSON string representation of the input

stringify.description:
Converts an arbitrary value to a JSON string representation.

Objects with cyclical references will trigger an exception.

If a whitelist is provided, only matching object keys will be included. Alternately, a replacer function may be passed as the second parameter. This function is executed on every value in the input, and its return value will be used in place of the original value. This is useful to serialize specialized objects or class instances.

If a positive integer or non-empty string is passed as the third parameter, the output will be formatted with carriage returns and indentation for readability. If a String is passed (such as "\t") it will be used once for each indentation level. If a number is passed, that number of spaces will be used.

params.name: o
params.description: any arbitrary value to convert to JSON string

params.name: w
params.description:
(optional) whitelist of acceptable object
keys to include, or a replacer function to modify the
raw value before serialization

params.name: ind
params.description:
(optional) indentation character or depth of
spaces to format the output.

Replaces specific unicode characters with their appropriate \unnnn

_revive.description:
Traverses nested objects, applying a reviver function to each (key,value)
from the scope if the key:value's containing object.  The value returned
from the function will replace the original value in the key:value pair.
If the value returned is undefined, the key will be omitted from the
returned object.

params.name: data

JSON.description:
The JSON module adds support for serializing JavaScript objects into JSON strings and parsing JavaScript objects from strings in JSON format.

The JSON namespace is added to your YUI instance including static methods Y.JSON.parse(..) and Y.JSON.stringify(..).

The functionality and method signatures follow the ECMAScript 5 specification. In browsers with native JSON support, the native implementation is used.

The json module is a rollup of json-parse and json-stringify.

As their names suggest, json-parse adds support for parsing JSON data (Y.JSON.parse) and json-stringify for serializing JavaScript data into JSON strings (Y.JSON.stringify). You may choose to include either of the submodules individually if you don't need the complementary functionality, or include the rollup for both.

_BRACKETS.description:
Third step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to remove all open
square brackets following a colon, comma, or at the beginning of the
string.

_UNICODE_EXCEPTIONS.description:
Replace certain Unicode characters that JavaScript may handle incorrectly
during eval--either by deleting them or treating them as line
endings--with escape sequences.
IMPORTANT NOTE: This regex will be used to modify the input if a match is
found.

useNativeParse.description:
Leverage native JSON parse if the browser has a native implementation.
In general, this is a good idea.  See the Known Issues section in the
JSON user guide for caveats.  The default value is true for browsers with
native JSON support.

JSON.useNativeStringify.description:
Leverage native JSON stringify if the browser has a native
implementation.  In general, this is a good idea.  See the Known Issues
section in the JSON user guide for caveats.  The default value is true
for browsers with native JSON support.

_UNSAFE.description:
Final step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to test the string left
after all previous replacements for invalid characters.

_ESCAPES.description:
First step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to replace all escape
sequences (i.e. "\\", etc) with '@' characters (a non-JSON character).

_VALUES.description:
Second step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to replace all simple
values with ']' characters.

Native.description: Alias to native browser implementation of the JSON object if available.

params.type:
Object} (Optional) Object literal of configuration values:
format {String} (Optional)

Any strftime string is supported, such as "%I:%M:%S %p". strftime has several format specifiers defined by the Open group at http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/007908799/xsh/strftime.html PHP added a few of its own, defined at http://www.php.net/strftime

This javascript implementation supports all the PHP specifiers and a few more. The full list is below.

If not specified, it defaults to the ISO8601 standard date format: %Y-%m-%d. This may be overridden by changing Y.config.dateFormat

%a
abbreviated weekday name according to the current locale
%A
full weekday name according to the current locale
%b
abbreviated month name according to the current locale
%B
full month name according to the current locale
%c
preferred date and time representation for the current locale
%C
century number (the year divided by 100 and truncated to an integer, range 00 to 99)
%d
day of the month as a decimal number (range 01 to 31)
%D
same as %m/%d/%y
%e
day of the month as a decimal number, a single digit is preceded by a space (range " 1" to "31")
%F
same as %Y-%m-%d (ISO 8601 date format)
%g
like %G, but without the century
%G
The 4-digit year corresponding to the ISO week number
%h
same as %b
%H
hour as a decimal number using a 24-hour clock (range 00 to 23)
%I
hour as a decimal number using a 12-hour clock (range 01 to 12)
%j
day of the year as a decimal number (range 001 to 366)
%k
hour as a decimal number using a 24-hour clock (range 0 to 23); single digits are preceded by a blank. (See also %H.)
%l
hour as a decimal number using a 12-hour clock (range 1 to 12); single digits are preceded by a blank. (See also %I.)
%m
month as a decimal number (range 01 to 12)
%M
minute as a decimal number
%n
newline character
%p
either "AM" or "PM" according to the given time value, or the corresponding strings for the current locale
%P
like %p, but lower case
%r
time in a.m. and p.m. notation equal to %I:%M:%S %p
%R
time in 24 hour notation equal to %H:%M
%s
number of seconds since the Epoch, ie, since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC
%S
second as a decimal number
%t
tab character
%T
current time, equal to %H:%M:%S
%u
weekday as a decimal number [1,7], with 1 representing Monday
%U
week number of the current year as a decimal number, starting with the first Sunday as the first day of the first week
%V
The ISO 8601:1988 week number of the current year as a decimal number, range 01 to 53, where week 1 is the first week that has at least 4 days in the current year, and with Monday as the first day of the week.
%w
day of the week as a decimal, Sunday being 0
%W
week number of the current year as a decimal number, starting with the first Monday as the first day of the first week
%x
preferred date representation for the current locale without the time
%X
preferred time representation for the current locale without the date
%y
year as a decimal number without a century (range 00 to 99)
%Y
year as a decimal number including the century
%z
numerical time zone representation
%Z
time zone name or abbreviation
%%
a literal "%" character
locale {String
params.name: oConfig
params.description:
(Optional)</dt>
<dd>
The locale to use when displaying days of week, months of the year, and other locale specific
strings. If not specified, this defaults to "en" (though this may be overridden by changing Y.config.locale).
The following locales are built in:
<dl>
<dt>en</dt>
<dd>English</dd>
<dt>en-US</dt>
<dd>US English</dd>
<dt>en-GB</dt>
<dd>British English</dd>
<dt>en-AU</dt>
<dd>Australian English (identical to British English)</dd>
</dl>
More locales may be added by subclassing of Y.DataType.Date.Locale["en"].
See Y.DataType.Date.Locale for more information.
</dd>
</dl>

Y.Lang.isFunction(obj.getAttribute) // reports false in IE
var input = document.createElement("input"); // append to body
Y.Lang.isFunction(input.focus) // reports false in IE
You will have to implement additional tests if these functions
matter to you.

DD.Drag.name: DD.Drag

node.description: Y.Node instanace to use as the element to initiate a drag operation

activeHandle.description: This config option is set by Drag to inform you of which handle fired the drag event (in the case that there are several handles): default false.

dragNode.description: Y.Node instanace to use as the draggable element, defaults to node

move.description: If this is false, the drag element will not move with the cursor: default true. Can be used to "resize" the element.

target.description: This attribute only works if the dd-drop module has been loaded. It will make this node a drop target as well as draggable.

lock.description: Set to lock this drag element so that it can't be dragged: default false.

offsetNode.description: Offset the drag element by the difference in cursor position: default true

handles.description: Array of valid handles to add. Adding something here will set all handles, even if previously added with addHandle

clickPixelThresh.description: The number of pixels to move to start a drag operation, default is 3.

groups.description: Array of groups to add this drag into.

useShim.description: Use the protective shim on all drag operations: default true. Only works with dd-ddm, not dd-ddm-base.

dragMode.description: This attribute only works if the dd-drop module is active. It will set the dragMode (point, intersect, strict) of this Drag instance.

bubbles.description: Controls the default bubble parent for this Drag instance. Default: Y.DD.DDM. Set to false to disable bubbling.

dragging.description: This attribute is not meant to be used by the implementor, it is meant to be used as an Event tracker so you can listen for it to change.

data.description: A payload holder to store arbitrary data about this drag object, can be used to store any value.

primaryButtonOnly.description: By default a drag operation will only begin if the mousedown occurred with the primary mouse button. Setting this to false will allow for all mousedown events to trigger a drag.

clickTimeThresh.description: The number of milliseconds a mousedown has to pass to start a drag operation, default is 1000.

constructors.description: This class provides the ability to drag a Node.

_groups.description: Storage Array for the groups this drag belongs to.

_handles.description: A private hash of the valid drag handles

_invalids.description: A private hash of the invalid selector strings

_ev_md.description: A private reference to the mousedown DOM event

target.description: This will be a reference to the Drop instance associated with this drag if the target: true config attribute is set..

mouseXY.description: The XY coords of the mousemove

_startTime.description: The getTime of the mousedown event. Not used, just here in case someone wants/needs to use it.

_endTime.description: The getTime of the mouseup event. Not used, just here in case someone wants/needs to use it.

region.description: A region object associated with this drag, used for checking regions while dragging.

_dragThreshMet.description: Private flag to see if the drag threshhold was met

actXY.description: The xy that the node will be set to. Changing this will alter the position as it's dragged.

deltaXY.description: The offset of the mouse position to the element's position

_invalidsDefault.description: A private hash of the default invalid selector strings: {'textarea': true, 'input': true, 'a': true, 'button': true, 'select': true}

lastXY.description: The position of the element as it's moving (for offset calculations)

_fromTimeout.description: Flag to determine if the drag operation came from a timeout

_ieSelectBack.description: We will hold a copy of the current "onselectstart" method on this property, and reset it after we are done using it.

realXY.description: The real xy position of the node.

addToGroup.description: Add this Drag instance to a group, this should be used for on-the-fly group additions.

params.name: g
params.description: The group to add this Drag Instance to.

params.name: xy
params.description: The XY coords to set the position to.

_setStartPosition.description: Sets the current position of the Element and calculates the offset

_fixDragStart.description: The function we use as the ondragstart handler when we start a drag in Internet Explorer. This keeps IE from blowing up on images as drag handles.

params.name: ev
params.description: The drag:drag event

_defDragFn.description: Default function for drag:drag. Fired from _moveNode.

stopDrag.description: Method will forcefully stop a drag operation. For example calling this from inside an ESC keypress handler will stop this drag.

params.name: ev
params.description: The mousemove DOM event

validClick.description: Method first checks to see if we have handles, if so it validates the click against the handle. Then if it finds a valid handle, it checks it against the invalid handles list. Returns true if a good handle was used, false otherwise.

removeInvalid.description: Remove an invalid handle added by addInvalid

params.name: str
params.description: The invalid handle to remove from the internal list.

addHandle.description: Add a handle to a drag element. Drag only initiates when a mousedown happens on this element.

params.description: The selector to test for a valid handle. Must be a child of the element.

removeHandle.description: Remove a Selector added by addHandle

params.description: The selector for the handle to be removed.

_moveNode.description: This method performs the actual element move.

destructor.description: Lifecycle destructor, unreg the drag from the DDM and remove listeners

params.name: e
params.description: The drag:align event.

_defAlignFn.description: Calculates the offsets and set's the XY that the element will move to.

_createEvents.description: This method creates all the events for this Event Target and publishes them so we get Event Bubbling.

_timeoutCheck.description: The method passed to setTimeout to determine if the clickTimeThreshold was met.

removeFromGroup.description: Remove this Drag instance from a group, this should be used for on-the-fly group removals.

params.name: g
params.description: The group to remove this Drag Instance from.

_fixIEMouseUp.description: This method copies the _ieSelectFix property back to the onselectstart listner on the document.

params.name: eXY
params.description: The XY to move the element to, usually comes from the mousemove DOM event.

_prep.description: Attach event listners and add classname

params.description: The selector to test against to determine if this is an invalid drag handle.

AsyncQueue.name: AsyncQueue

params.name: callback*
params.description: 0..n callbacks to seed the queue

constructors.description:
A specialized queue class that supports scheduling callbacks to execute sequentially, iteratively, even asynchronously.

Callbacks can be function refs or objects with the following keys. Only the fn key is required.

  • fn -- The callback function
  • context -- The execution context for the callbackFn.
  • args -- Arguments to pass to callbackFn.
  • timeout -- Millisecond delay before executing callbackFn. (Applies to each iterative execution of callback)
  • iterations -- Number of times to repeat the callback.
  • until -- Repeat the callback until this function returns true. This setting trumps iterations.
  • autoContinue -- Set to false to prevent the AsyncQueue from executing the next callback in the Queue after the callback completes.
  • id -- Name that can be used to get, promote, get the indexOf, or delete this callback.

complete.description: Event fired after the last queued callback is executed.

params.name: e
params.description: the custom event

_defRemoveFn.description:
Default functionality for the "remove" event. Removes the callback from the queue.

The event object will contain a property "callback", which holds the id of a callback or the callback object itself.

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

pause.description:
Pause the execution of the queue after the execution of the current
callback completes.  If called from code outside of a queued callback,
clears the timeout for the pending callback. Paused queue can be
restarted with q.run()

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

run.description:
Sets the queue in motion.  All queued callbacks will be executed in
order unless pause() or stop() is called or if one of the callbacks is
configured with autoContinue: false.

return.description: whether the run loop should continue

_schedule.description: Schedules the execution of asynchronous callbacks.

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object to execute

params.name: e
params.description: The event object

_defShiftFn.description: Default functionality for the "shift" event. Shifts the callback stored in the event object's callback property from the queue if it is the first item.

return.description: whether the run loop should continue

_execute.description:
Handles the execution of callbacks. Returns a boolean indicating
whether it is appropriate to continue running.

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object to execute

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

stop.description:
Stop and clear the queue after the current execution of the
current callback completes.

_init.description: Initializes the AsyncQueue instance properties and events.

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

remove.description:
Removes the callback from the queue.  If the queue is active, the
removal is scheduled to occur after the current callback has completed.

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object or a callback's id

return.description: the callback to execute

next.description:
Returns the next callback needing execution.  If a callback is
configured to repeat via iterations or until, it will be returned until
the completion criteria is met.
When the queue is empty, null is returned.

return.description: index of the callback or -1 if not found

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback or its specified id

indexOf.description:
Returns the current index of a callback.  Pass in either the id or
callback function from getCallback.

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

add.description:
Add any number of callbacks to the end of the queue. Callbacks may be
provided as functions or objects.

params.name: callback*
params.description: 0..n callbacks

params.name: e
params.description: the event object

_defExecFn.description:
Default functionality for the "execute" event.  Executes the
callback function

return.description: the callback object

params.name: id
params.description: the id assigned to the callback

getCallback.description:
Retrieve a callback by its id.  Useful to modify the configuration
while the queue is running.

params.name: e
params.description: the custom event

_defPromoteFn.description:
Default functionality for the "promote" event. Promotes the named callback to the head of the queue.

The event object will contain a property "callback", which holds the id of a callback or the callback object itself.

return.description: a decorated function wrapper to execute the callback

_prepare.description:
Creates a wrapper function to execute the callback using the aggregated 
configuration generated by combining the static AsyncQueue.defaults, the
instance defaults, and the specified callback settings.
The wrapper function is decorated with the callback configuration as
properties for runtime modification.

params.name: callback
params.description: the raw callback

return.description: the AsyncQueue instance

promote.description:
Promotes the named callback to the top of the queue. If a callback is
currently executing or looping (via until or iterations), the promotion
is scheduled to occur after the current callback has completed.

params.name: callback
params.description: the callback object or a callback's id

params.name: e
params.description: the event object

_defAddFn.description: Default functionality for the "add" event. Adds the callbacks in the event facade to the queue. Callbacks successfully added to the queue are present in the event's added property in the after phase.

return.description:
true if queue is waiting for a 
from any initiated transactions

isRunning.description: Determines if the queue is waiting for a callback to complete execution.

size.description: Returns the number of callbacks in the queue.

AsyncQueue.defaults.description:
Static default values used to populate callback configuration properties. Preconfigured defaults include:

  • autoContinue: true
  • iterations: 1
  • timeout: 10 (10ms between callbacks)
  • until: (function to run until iterations <= 0)

_running.type:
{Boolean|Object} true for synchronous callback execution, the
return handle from Y.later for async callbacks.
Otherwise false.
_running.description: Used to indicate the queue is currently executing a callback.

defaults.description:
Callback defaults for this instance.  Static defaults that are not
overridden are also included.

AsyncQueue.description:
A specialized queue class that supports scheduling callbacks to execute sequentially, iteratively, even asynchronously.

Callbacks can be function refs or objects with the following keys. Only the fn key is required.

  • fn -- The callback function
  • context -- The execution context for the callbackFn.
  • args -- Arguments to pass to callbackFn.
  • timeout -- Millisecond delay before executing callbackFn. (Applies to each iterative execution of callback)
  • iterations -- Number of times to repeat the callback.
  • until -- Repeat the callback until this function returns true. This setting trumps iterations.
  • autoContinue -- Set to false to prevent the AsyncQueue from executing the next callback in the Queue after the callback completes.
  • id -- Name that can be used to get, promote, get the indexOf, or delete this callback.

Attribute.name: Attribute
Attribute.description:
Attribute provides configurable attribute support along with attribute change events. It is designed to be augmented on to a host class, and provides the host with the ability to configure attributes to store and retrieve state, along with attribute change events.

For example, attributes added to the host can be configured:

  • As read only.
  • As write once.
  • With a setter function, which can be used to manipulate values passed to Attribute's set method, before they are stored.
  • With a getter function, which can be used to manipulate stored values, before they are returned by Attribute's get method.
  • With a validator function, to validate values before they are stored.

See the addAttr method, for the complete set of configuration options available for attributes

.

NOTE: Most implementations will be better off extending the Base class, instead of augmenting Attribute directly. Base augments Attribute and will handle the initial configuration of attributes for derived classes, accounting for values passed into the constructor.

Attribute._ATTR_CFG.description:
The list of properties which can be configured for 
each attribute (e.g. setter, getter, writeOnce etc.).
This property is used internally as a whitelist for faster
Y.mix operations.

Attribute.INVALID_VALUE.description:
The value to return from an attribute setter in order to prevent the set from going through.

You can return this value from your setter if you wish to combine validator and setter functionality into a single setter function, which either returns the massaged value to be stored or Attribute.INVALID_VALUE to prevent invalid values from being stored.

return.description: true if the new attribute value was stored, false if not.

_setAttrVal.description:
Updates the stored value of the attribute in the privately held State object,
if validation and setter passes.

params.name: attrName
params.description: The attribute name.

params.name: subAttrName
params.description: The sub-attribute name, if setting a sub-attribute property ("x.y.z").

params.name: prevVal
params.description: The currently stored value of the attribute.

params.name: newVal
params.description: The value which is going to be stored.

return.description: A reference to the host object.

set.description: Sets the value of an attribute.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the attribute. If the current value of the attribute is an Object, dot notation can be used to set the value of a property within the object (e.g. set("x.y.z", 5)).

params.name: value
params.description: The value to set the attribute to.

params.name: opts
params.description:
(Optional) Optional event data to be mixed into
the event facade passed to subscribers of the attribute's change event. This 
can be used as a flexible way to identify the source of a call to set, allowing 
the developer to distinguish between set called internally by the host, vs. 
set called externally by the application developer.

return.description: An object with attribute name/value pairs.

params.name: attrs
params.description:
Optional. An array of attribute names. If omitted, all attribute values are
returned. If set to true, all attributes modified from their initial values are returned.

params.name: attrName
params.description: The name of the attribute

params.name: subAttrName
params.description:
The full path of the property being changed, 
if this is a sub-attribute value being change. Otherwise null.

params.name: currVal
params.description: The current value of the attribute

params.name: newVal
params.description: The new value of the attribute

params.name: opts
params.description: Any additional event data to mix into the attribute change event's event facade.

_fireAttrChange.description: Utility method to help setup the event payload and fire the attribute change event.

params.name: name

Updates the configuration of an attribute which has already been added.

The properties which can be modified through this interface are limited to the following subset of attributes, which can be safely modified after a value has already been set on the attribute: readOnly, writeOnce, broadcast and getter.

return.description: A protected version of the attrs argument.

_protectAttrs.description:

hash, by merging the entire object and the individual 
attr config objects.

params.name: attrs

return.description: A reference to the host object.

Returns the initial value of the given attribute from

params.name: cfg
params.description: The attribute configuration object

_getAttrInitVal.param: {String} attr The name of the attribute

return.description: The value of the attribute.

_getAttr.description: Provides the common implementation for the public get method, allowing Attribute hosts to over-ride either method. See get for argument details.

params.description: The name of the attribute.

return.description: An object with attribute name/value pairs.

params.name: name
